intro: Youngia paleacea, commonly known as the paleface dandelion, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while the flowers are yellow with a distinctive white center. Youngia paleacea is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
